clues.text: Tahiti is part of the 130-island group called French this
Named for one of the country's early prime ministers, Fox Glacier is found on this nation's South Island
Cornelius Houtman established Dutch trade from Java to this island off Africa, 4th-largest in the world
To visit this windy South American plateau, you may want to bring a Synchilla jacket from the company of the same name
The Princess Ragnhild Coast is part of this Antarctic land named for a Norwegian queen
Alexandra Pauline Cohen uses this first name, the Ukrainian nickname for Alexandra
While racking up U.S. championships year after year, she settled for Olympic silver in 1998 & bronze in 2002
This skater known for her hairstyle bought the Ice Capades in 1993 but sold it 2 years later
She was the only American to win an Olympic gold medal at the 1968 Winter Games in Grenoble
Born to Polish parents in Philadelphia, she became the youngest world champion in 1997 at age 14
He worked as a copywriter for Time magazine &, in his spare time, wrote the novel "Catch-22"
A girl is cursed with the "gift" of obedience in the novel titled her "Enchanted"
This Indianapolis-born author's drawings can be seen in his books "Slaughterhouse-Five" & "Breakfast of Champions"
He received international fame in 1878 for his story about Daisy Miller, an American flirt in Europe
In this Ernest Gaines novel set in the '40s, Grant Wiggins must teach an innocent man on death row to die like a man
In 2007 a judge ruled that a Santa Barbara newspaper had illegally fired workers for trying to join this
This final payment is often 1 or 2 weeks' pay per year of service
Douglas MacArthur is among those who've been fired for this, disobedient resistance to authority
From the Latin for "end", this word often follows "wrongful"
The 2008 firing of the Oakland Raiders' coach was "for" this, meaning coach doesn't get the rest of the money
She announced her breakup with Guy Ritchie saying they "can't bear to live with the pretence any longer"
Never mind the Sex Pistols, this punk couple found life after death as a 1986 feature film
While in rehab, she sang at the Grammys from London about not going to rehab
It's hard "keeping up with" this family that includes spoiled, sometimes-clothed rich girl Kim & Mrs. Bruce Jenner
This rapper's song "Kim" expresses non-amicable feelings toward his on-again, off-again wife
At 14,270 feet, Grays Peak is the highest point on the Continental Divide & one of this state's highest mountains
In literature Basil Hallward is the artist who paints the picture of him
The scientific name of this 2-word creature is Canis lupus
Gray-haired & gray-bearded, he was the USA's "good gray poet"
He succeeded J. Edgar Hoover as head of the FBI
"Brewed with pure Rocky Mountain spring water"
"You never forget your first girl"
"The beer that made Milwaukee famous"
"Tastes as great as its name"
"Head for the mountains"
After a quaff of a "drink me" vial, we're told this character "very seldom followed" her own good advice
A proverb says that this "seldom knocks twice"
"He that is discontented in one place will seldom be happy in another" is a moral from this Greek B.C. guy
Completes Dorothy Parker's verdict "Men seldom make passes at..."
James Madison said in these "papers" that "A bad cause seldom fails to betray itself"
Someone who "dampens" enthusiasm, or what Linus might use to extinguish a small fire
"Come to me" & tell me this state of gloominess comes from words meaning "black bile", baby
No, your toothpaste hasn't hit the ground, but this 11-letter word sure sounds like it
If you're an outcast, you may be in this discouraged state that can also refer to a glance at the ground
Built on the Latin for "peer", this word means to belittle or bring reproach upon

rounds.comments: (Alex: You have to identify the sender for us.)

clues.text:
To: Junglechick.
From: Mr_Simian.
Subject: Pronouns.
FYI, I do use "I" when referring to myself in a 1914 novel

To: Maneating_Harpooner,
From: lSailor. Captain A's off his nut. Call me scared

To: RButlerdidit. From: Melanies-man. Subject: Your marriage.
Your Southern wife loves me. Is that a problem?

To: LouisLouis.
From: Fangsalot.
Subject: Dinner.
I made you a vampire, let's have Italian tonight--his name is Gino

To: (general island mailing).
From: Asthmaboy. Subject: My name.
I'm not happy with the "porcine" name you boys gave me
The Beatles honed their chops playing clubs in the Reeperbahn, a red-light district in this German port city
One of 2 official Beatles German-language releases, "Komm, gib mir deine Hand" was the lads' take on this 1964 smash
Astrid Kirchherr & Klaus Voormann are characters in this movie dramatization of The Beatles' time in Germany
To please their rabid German fans, the boys re-recorded this hit as "Sie liebt dich" in 1964
While making "Let It Be", The Beatles recorded "Geh Raus", a German-language spoof of this No. 1 hit
In 2008 this company's 77-year run as the world's largest automaker came to an end
This Norse god hammered Hrungnir to death
In July 1918 this world leader was executed in the Ural Mountains
This element's symbol is Po
Exodus 2:10 says "and she called his name" this (it's Exodus, folks)

rounds.text: The Syracuse owner created this in 1954 & it may have helped his team succeed the Lakers as champs the next year
